design: Pre-FEED, FEED, Detailed Design, Procurement, Demolition, Construction Support
discipline: Mechanical, Process, Civil, Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation, Controls and Procurement
location: Outside Fort St. John, BC - Brownfield
description: Denali was responsible for the redevelopment of an existing 100MMSCFD sour gas facility to handle new producer gas volumes. Scope included new refrigeration unit, heat medium, 3.6MW total of generators, bullet storage, truck unloading and upgraded sweetening system packages as well as several utility systems upgrades. From the electrical side, Denali was responsible for the power generation integration plan, medium voltage development plan, and controls system development plan. Denali prepared a total installed cost estimate and evaluation including numerous engineering documents for the proposed brownfield facility improvements.

Mechanical design of power plant that produces 1.8MW of local grid power by using a combination of LNG and diesel for fuel. Evaluated numerous options for configurations and fuel usage to aid with end users economic evaluations. Created specifications and equipment RFP packages for 3 genset packages and other associated equipment.  Genset packages include jacket water heat recovery system to optimize energy efficiency within the power plant.

discipline: Mechanical, Process, Civil, Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation, Procurement
description: Denali evaluated the feasibility of installing power generation for the client at 6 of its sites to isolate from the utility grid to reduce operating costs. This included an evaluation of existing and future loads, selection of technology (turbine vs. reciprocating generators) preliminary block flow diagrams and Class 4 estimates for each site to evaluate economics of the proposed facilities. The sites ranged from 1 to 6 MW of required power production.

discipline: Mechanical, Process, Civil, Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation
description: Denali coordinated FEED engineering and regulatory support on behalf of their client for a greenfield marine terminal. Terminal products were LPG, Methanol and Clean Petroleum Products which are brought in by rail, stored, and pumped to ships on a new marine jetty/loading dock. The refrigerated LPG storage tank volume was 90,000m3 while the 18 total Methanol and Clean Petroleum Product tanks ranged from 30,000 to 40,000m3 in volume.

Denali was responsible for the mechanical design for the replacement of an 800 kW diesel engine at an existing power plant providing power for the local municipality. Reviewed feasibility of the replacement, as well as created construction drawings to integrate the new engine with the existing on-site utilities and generator.

Denali was responsible for reviewing the feasibility of replacing an 800 kW diesel engine at an existing power plant providing power for the local municipality. Reviewed feasibility of integrating the newer model engine within the existing infrastructure on site.

Denali was responsible for the mechanical design for the replacement of an 800 kW diesel genset at an existing power plant providing power for the local municipality. Reviewed feasibility of the replacement, as well as created construction drawings to integrate the new engine and generator with the existing on-site utilities.

Denali was responsible for reviewing the feasibility of replacing an 800 kW diesel genset at an existing power plant providing power for the local municipality. Reviewed feasibility of integrating the newer model engine and generator within the existing infrastructure on site.

design: FEED, Detailed Design, Procurement, Construction Support

description: Denali was responsible for the design of additional valve automation and truck scale upgrades.  This included a mass balance evaluation of existing metering and modifications to increase the overall mass balance accuracy of the Refinery.  Denali completed the FEED, detailed design and execution of the project throughout construction.

description: Denali was responsible for the full-service engineering and procurement of a new 175,000 BBL asphalt tank to an existing refinery. This included working with the site’s existing products and utility systems, as well as tying in for tank heating. Denali also re-designed multiple existing tank farms to assist in more efficient rail and truck loading systems. Significant civil and earthwork modifications were required to the facility to accommodate the new 175,000 BBL tank including design for removal of contaminated soil, new fill and containment wall. In addition to tank farm modifications Denali expanded and modified existing MCC, E-Houses and control rooms.

description: Denali was responsible for the full-service engineering and procurement of a new trucking system at an existing storage and shipping facility in Hardisty Alberta. Denali completed the FEED, detailed design and execution of the project throughout construction.  The scope included a new scale, building and measurement system to replace aging infrastructure. A large part of the project was related to civil design of the new area including road additions, drainage and accessibility to accommodate additional shipping and trucking volumes.

The scope included upgrades and replacement to existing building and measurement system due to aging infrastructure.

project: Refinery Electrical Distribution and Power Upgrade FEED Study
description: Denali was responsible for the FEED study to upgrade the electrical distribution system of a 60-year-old refinery. The project consisted of as-building existing infrastructure, designing the facility upgrade to a 60% level, developing a class 3 cost estimate, level 3 schedule, procurement plan and execution strategy for the project.

Due to the age of the existing control room and space constraints Denali preformed a FEED study to install a new control room for a 60-year-old Refinery and expand the existing DeltaV system. The project consisted of as-building existing infrastructure, control room building design to a 60% level, developing a class 3 cost estimate, level 3 schedule, procurement plan and execution strategy for the project.

Due to the age of the existing laboratory and space constraints Denali preformed a FEED study to install a new laboratory for a 60-year-old Refinery and expand provide automated procedures for lab sampling. The project consisted of as-building existing infrastructure, laboratory building design to a 60% level, developing a class 3 cost estimate, level 3 schedule, procurement plan and execution strategy for the project.

project: Tank CIR Maintenance and Modification Program
design: Detailed Design, Construction Support, Procurement Support, MOC’s
discipline: Mechanical, Process, Civil, Structural, Stress Analysis, Electrical, Instrumentation, Controls and Procurement
description: Denali was awarded tank cleaning, inspection and repair (CIR) maintenance and modification program for an oil refinery in Moosejaw Saskatchewan to meet regulatory compliance requirements and ensure the integrity of storage tank assets. Tanks were out of service to be cleaned and internally inspected in accordance with API 653. The program consisted of repair and modifications to nine tanks ranging from 25000 bbl to 150000 bbl. Tanks. New nozzles, steam systems, firewater systems, level and temperature measurement were added to each tank while out of service.
